result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Alex John Sittlow was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Includes DNA surcharge.
Apply bond on file and balance through a payment plan (Court sets internal review on costs).

***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham April 20, 2016 - Amend JOC for an additional 10 days credit (total 39 days).

Defendant remanded into custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff.
Huber granted.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment or therapy.
Driver Safety Plan.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. No appearances. Case called at 8:31. Court reviews file and information rec'd from the Sheriff. Jail is not willing to launder DE items separately. DE personally launders his clothing
himself. ADA Hartung was empathetic to the DE allergy issues. 05-31-2016 the Court granted a 2 week furlough to allow DE to meet with his Dr. Sheriff has made contact with the Court. DE is currently sitting a straight sentence 
not condition time a Court does not have authority to authorize a furlough. Court will vacate the Order for Furlough and remands DE to the St. Croix County Jail.
for Furlough signed by SRN 5/31/16.  fax: Jail. eif

**AMENDED**

- DE to report to the Somerset PD every day before 5:00pm to complete a PBT test. If Somerset cannot do a PBT DE to report to 
  St. Croix County Jail. 

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.  

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- June 14th DE to report back to the Jail or pending electionic monitioring confirmation (to begin on the 14th)

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Matthew L. Hartung, DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson, DF: Alex John Sittlow appeared.  Court called at 8:40 a.m.  Set for Plea hearing.  ADA Hartung advises the court that there is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  DE sworn.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts from the preliminary hearing.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE guilty of Ct 1 and find it is the DE's 4th offense. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4 & Ct 5 with prejudice.  No PSI is ordered by the attorneys.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders for Ct. 1 in 15CF47:

DE sentenced to 12 months in the St. Croix County Jail
- DE to report to jail today 12/04/15 and remands the DE to the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 29 days time served
- Apology letter to Edward Plourde within 30 days from this hearing day
- Restorative Justice if the victim requests
- AODA together with the driver safety plan and any recommended treatment and therapy
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- 30 month driver's license revocation
- 30 month IID
- Court costs of $2502.00 which includes the DNA surcharge.
- Apply money on file (Including any remaining monies from the bond on 15CF505)
- Restitution of $85.50 for the blood draw
- DE will set up a payment plan on any remaining balances if huber is granted and Court will set for 9 month internal review on costs.
- Huber is granted
- 20 days to appeal
  Review scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 07:45 am.
Plea hearing at 12-04-2015 08:30 am
Plea hearing at 11-23-2015 04:15 pm

Final pre-trial at 03-01-2016 03:00 pm.
Jury trial at 03-15-2016 08:00 am.
and Order signed by SRN 7/24/15 -  Defendant's motion to exclude the use of his prior conviction in Washington Co, MN is DENIED. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson, DF:  Alex John Sittlow appeared. Case called at 3:00 p.m. Court reviews file and denies motion to proceed with collateral attack. Atty. Nelson makes statement. Alex Sittlow S/T. Direct by ADA Hartung. ADA Hartung introduces Exhibit #3, Transcript, Atty. Nelson stipulates to Exhibit #3, Court receives. ADA Hartung offers Exhibit #1, Petition to Plead Guilty to OWI, O/R  . Exhibit #2, Affidavit, introduced by ADA Hartung and stipulated to by Atty. Nelson, Court receives. Cross by Atty. Nelson. Re-direct by ADA Hartung. Court questions the witness. Court affirms original decision to deny motion for collateral attack. Attys to see JA for trial scheduling. Final pre-trial date to be scheduled 3 weeks prior to trial, which will be the cut off date for negotiations. Address confirmed, bond continues. Adjourned 3:42 p.m.
to Defendant's Collateral Attack Motion. Filed by ADA McKinley. km
Hearing on July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
